thread.title: Former Florida Gators coach Steve Spurrier retiring
thread.title_full: Former Florida Gators coach Steve Spurrier retiring

title: Former Florida Gators coach Steve Spurrier retiring
text:
Posted: 9:40 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 Former Florida Gators coach Steve Spurrier retiring Related Steve Spurrier, former Florida Gators football coach and current South Carolina coach, is retiring, Action Sports Jax has learned. Latest news and weather from Action News South Carolina head coach Steve Spurrier reacts during the second half of an NCAA college football game against LSU in Baton Rouge, La., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. LSU won 45-24. (AP Photo/Jonathan Bachman) Sponsored Links COLUMBIA, S.C. â€” 
Steve Spurrier, former Florida Gators football coach and current South Carolina Gamecocks coach, is retiring effective immediately, Action Sports Jax has learned.So far, the Gamecocks are winless in the SEC this year. Spurrier resurrected South Carolina's program, but he's known for his time in Gainesville. 
Latest News Headlines from Action News 
An innovator on offense, he made the Gators dominant in the '90s, winning a national championship with the team in 1996. Spurrier also played for the Gators and was a Heisman Trophy winner in 1966.During his 11 years as Gators coach, Spurrier won six SEC Championships. He was named a 9-time Conference Coach of the Year during his years in the SEC.Spurrier is 70 years old and has a home in Crescent Beach.
